# startTask(toClear:)

**Instance Method**

Fills the entire destination with black or clear depending on its [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderDestination/alphaMode].

## Declaration

```swift
func startTask(toClear destination: CIRenderDestination) throws -> CIRenderTask
```

## Parameters

- **destination**: The [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderDestination] to clear.

## Return Value

The asynchronous [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderTask] for clearing the destination.

## Discussion

If the destination’s [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderDestination/alphaMode] is [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderDestinationAlphaMode/none], this command fills the entire destination with black `(0, 0, 0, 1)`.

If the destination’s [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderDestination/alphaMode] is [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderDestinationAlphaMode/premultiplied] or [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIRenderDestinationAlphaMode/unpremultiplied], this command fills the entire destination with clear `(0, 0, 0, 0)`.

## Customizing Render Destination

- **prepareRender(_:from:to:at:)**: An optional call to warm up a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIContext] so that subsequent calls to render with the same arguments run more efficiently.
- **startTask(toRender:from:to:at:)**: Renders a portion of an image to a point in the destination.
- **startTask(toRender:to:)**: Renders an image to a destination so that point (0, 0) of the image maps to point (0, 0) of the destination.
